description: Manages as an Azure Container Group instance.

Commands.description: A list of commands which should be run on the container. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

Cpu.description: The required number of CPU cores of the containers. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

EnvironmentVariables.description: A list of environment variables to be set on the container. Specified as a map of name/value pairs. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

Image.description: The container image name. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

Memory.description: The required memory of the containers in GB. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

Name.description: Specifies the name of the Container. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

SecureEnvironmentVariables.description: A list of sensitive environment variables to be set on the container. Specified as a map of name/value pairs. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

IdentityIds.description: Specifies a list of user managed identity ids to be assigned. Required if `type` is `UserAssigned`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

Type.description: The Managed Service Identity Type of this container group. Possible values are `SystemAssigned` (where Azure will generate a Service Principal for you), `UserAssigned` where you can specify the Service Principal IDs in the `identity_ids` field, and `SystemAssigned, UserAssigned` which assigns both a system managed identity as well as the specified user assigned identities. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

Password.description: The password with which to connect to the registry. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

Server.description: The address to use to connect to the registry without protocol ("https"/"http"). For example: "myacr.acr.io". Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

Username.description: The username with which to connect to the registry. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

Count.description: The number of GPUs which should be assigned to this container. Allowed values are `1`, `2`, or `4`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

Sku.description: The Sku which should be used for the GPU. Possible values are `K80`, `P100`, or `V100`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

Exec.description: Commands to be run to validate container readiness. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

FailureThreshold.description: How many times to try the probe before restarting the container (liveness probe) or marking the container as unhealthy (readiness probe). The default value is `3` and the minimum value is `1`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

InitialDelaySeconds.description: Number of seconds after the container has started before liveness or readiness probes are initiated. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

PeriodSeconds.description: How often (in seconds) to perform the probe. The default value is `10` and the minimum value is `1`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

SuccessThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive successes for the probe to be considered successful after having failed. The default value is `1` and the minimum value is `1`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

TimeoutSeconds.description: Number of seconds after which the probe times out. The default value is `1` and the minimum value is `1`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

Port.description: The port number the container will expose. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

Protocol.description: The network protocol associated with port. Possible values are `TCP` & `UDP`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

Exec.description: Commands to be run to validate container readiness. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

FailureThreshold.description: How many times to try the probe before restarting the container (liveness probe) or marking the container as unhealthy (readiness probe). The default value is `3` and the minimum value is `1`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

InitialDelaySeconds.description: Number of seconds after the container has started before liveness or readiness probes are initiated. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

PeriodSeconds.description: How often (in seconds) to perform the probe. The default value is `10` and the minimum value is `1`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

SuccessThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive successes for the probe to be considered successful after having failed. The default value is `1` and the minimum value is `1`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

TimeoutSeconds.description: Number of seconds after which the probe times out. The default value is `1` and the minimum value is `1`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

MountPath.description: The path on which this volume is to be mounted. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

Name.description: The name of the volume mount. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

ReadOnly.description: Specify if the volume is to be mounted as read only or not. The default value is `false`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

ShareName.description: The Azure storage share that is to be mounted as a volume. This must be created on the storage account specified as above. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

StorageAccountKey.description: The access key for the Azure Storage account specified as above. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

StorageAccountName.description: The Azure storage account from which the volume is to be mounted. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

LogType.description: The log type which should be used. Possible values are `ContainerInsights` and `ContainerInstanceLogs`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

Metadata.description: Any metadata required for Log Analytics. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

WorkspaceId.description: The Workspace ID of the Log Analytics Workspace. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

WorkspaceKey.description: The Workspace Key of the Log Analytics Workspace. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

Path.description: Path to access on the HTTP server. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

Port.description: Number of the port to access on the container. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

Scheme.description: Scheme to use for connecting to the host. Possible values are `Http` and `Https`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

tfcfnid.description: Internal identifier for tracking resource changes. Do not use.

DnsNameLabel.description: The DNS label/name for the container groups IP. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

IpAddressType.description: Specifies the ip address type of the container. `Public` or `Private`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. If set to `Private`, `network_profile_id` also needs to be set.

Location.description: Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

Name.description: Specifies the name of the Container Group. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

NetworkProfileId.description: Network profile ID for deploying to virtual network.

OsType.description: The OS for the container group. Allowed values are `Linux` and `Windows`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

ResourceGroupName.description: The name of the resource group in which to create the Container Group. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

RestartPolicy.description: Restart policy for the container group. Allowed values are `Always`, `Never`, `OnFailure`. Defaults to `Always`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

Tags.description: A mapping of tags to assign to the resource. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
